name: Poseidon
subtitle: God of the Sea, Earthquakes, and Horses
description: One of the three great sons of Kronos who divided the cosmos, Poseidon commands the vast oceans, shakes the earth with his mighty trident, and created the first horses. Known as the Earth-Shaker and Lord of the Seas, he embodies the dual nature of water itself: life-giving sustenance and terrifying destruction. Sailors, fishermen, and coastal peoples throughout the ancient world honored this tempestuous deity.

summary: One of the three great sons of Kronos who divided the cosmos, Poseidon commands the vast oceans, shakes the earth with his mighty trident, and created the first horses.  Known as the Earth-Shaker and Lord of the Seas, he embodies the dual nature of water itself: life-giving sustenance and terrifying destruction.
cultural_significance: Rules over oceans, waterways, and maritime endeavors

topic_panels.title: Origins & Mythology
topic_panels.content:
### Sacred Origins

Poseidon's mythology primordial chaos, Titans, Olympians. The deity's role in Greek cosmology reflects fundamental aspects of how ancient peoples understood divine power and cosmic order.

### Creation Accounts

Primary sources describe Poseidon's emergence and divine nature through various sacred narratives. These origin stories served both religious and cultural functions, establishing divine authority and cosmic principles.

**Time Period:** c. 800 BCE - 400 CE

topic_panels.title: Worship & Practice
topic_panels.content:
### Religious Practice

Worship of Poseidon involved temple sacrifices, festivals, oracles. These practices created sacred bonds between devotees and the divine realm.

### Sacred Sites

Throughout Ancient Greece, Mediterranean basin, temples and shrines dedicated to Poseidon served as focal points for religious activity. Priests and priestesses maintained sacred rituals that ensured divine favor and cosmic balance.

### Festivals & Ceremonies

Special festivals celebrated Poseidon's divine attributes and mythological deeds, bringing communities together in shared religious expression.

topic_panels.title: Symbols & Iconography
topic_panels.content:
### Sacred Symbols

Key symbols associated with Poseidon:

- **Trident**: Represents divine power and sacred authority
- **dolphins**: Represents divine power and sacred authority
- **horses**: Represents divine power and sacred authority
- **bull**: Represents divine power and sacred authority
- **chariot**: Represents divine power and sacred authority

### Divine Attributes

As deity of Seas, oceans, storms, earthquakes, horses, navigation, floods, springs, coastal regions, Poseidon embodies these cosmic principles. The iconography reveals how ancient peoples visualized divine power and cosmic forces.

### Artistic Representations

Ancient artworks depict Poseidon with distinctive attributes that communicate divine identity and authority to worshippers.

topic_panels.title: Modern Influence
topic_panels.content:
### Cultural Legacy

Western literature, psychology, philosophy. The mythology of Poseidon continues to resonate in contemporary culture, literature, and spiritual practices.

### Academic Study

Modern scholars analyze Poseidon's mythology through multiple lenses‚Äîreligious studies, anthropology, archaeology, and comparative mythology‚Äîrevealing insights into ancient worldviews.

### Popular Culture

Poseidon appears in modern media, from fantasy novels to video games, demonstrating the enduring power of ancient mythology to capture human imagination and address timeless questions.

related_myths.title: The Birth of Poseidon
related_myths.summary: The sacred account of how Poseidon came into being, establishing their divine authority and cosmic role in Greek mythology.

related_myths.title: Poseidon and the Sacred Quest
related_myths.summary: A legendary tale of Poseidon's heroic deeds or cosmic achievements that shaped the world and demonstrated divine power.

related_myths.title: Poseidon and the Divine Council
related_myths.summary: Stories of Poseidon's interactions with other deities, revealing the complex relationships and hierarchies of the Greek pantheon.

related_myths.title: Poseidon and the Gift of Seas
related_myths.summary: The mythological account of how Poseidon became associated with Seas and bestowed this gift upon humanity or the cosmos.

related_myths.title: The Legacy of Poseidon
related_myths.summary: How Poseidon's actions and teachings continue to influence the world, establishing sacred traditions and cosmic principles.
